questions.question: Not a Bad Throw for a Rookie
An advantage of using solar power is

answers.answer: no greenhouse gases
lots of pollution
it is available even on cloudy days

questions.question: An advantage of using hydroelectric power is

answers.answer: reservoirs can be used for irrigation of crops
sometimes surrounding area get flooded
the normal flow of the water is diverted

questions.question: Most utility companies in the U.S. dont use hydroelectric power because

answers.answer: the plants are expensive to build and use expensive machinery
reservoirs can be used to irrigate crops and they dont want to help farmers
it cause a lot of greenhouse gases

questions.question: Which energy source would be best for a city that has limited space and want to be effecient?

answers.answer: solar-costly to build and 6%-30% efficient
Wind-turbines need lots of free space 40%-60% efficient
Natural gas-can be used in small areas 50%-60% efficient

questions.question: What is a major disadvantage of nuclear power?

answers.answer: it produces small amounts of power
the by-product(waste) is nuclear radiation
power plants are inexpensive to build

questions.question: If a community were choosing between solar and wind; what advantage would make wind the best choice?

answers.answer: locations for turbines are limited because the wind can be blocked
solar needs a back up system for cloudy days
wind energy is less expensive and it is limitless

questions.question: An advantage of burning coal for energy is

answers.answer: it is an inexpensive source of energy
it does not pollute the air
it is a renewable energy source

questions.question: An advantage of using natural gas as a form of energy is

answers.answer: it is more expensive compared to other fossil fuels
It produces low emissions(pollution) compared to other fossil fuels
there is a more limited supply compared to other fossil fuels

questions.question: What do geothermal and solar energy have in common?

answers.answer: they both use sunlight to generate energy
both are non-renewable energy sources
neither produce greenhouse gases
